div.p: Grace and innocence of life from God the Father through Jesus Christ. I sent a letter to you through Master Augustin Mainard, most esteemed Bullinger, who wanted to have special letters from me. Indeed, one would have sufficed for both, and I would have relieved you of this labor. Here is the other part of the controversy, Doctor Franz Stancarus of Mantua, as I hear, a man highly learned in languages, a Christian and pious man, also known to me for fourteen years, also eager to know Bullinger. The reason they come to Zürich, I touched upon in Master Augustin's letters; here I omit it for the sake of brevity. Therefore, act with your humanity with these men, as you are accustomed. Farewell.
From the Court of Rhaetia, on the first of June, 1548.
To the most distinguished man in humanity and learning, Master Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant bishop of the Zürich church, his lord and primary friend.
